configuration.name: widget_07011750976486164
configuration.stem: Leaves are plant organs that capture sunlight and produce food for the plant. Roots are organs that take up water and nutrients from the soil. Would you expect the cells that make up leaf tissue to look similar or different from the cells in the root tissue? Explain your answer.
configuration.teacherAnswer: All cells have some similarities, such as cell membranes. Cells that are part of different tissues perform different functions, so I think root cells and leaf cells would look a little different. Leaf cells would probably have a lot of chloroplasts, and root cells would not.
configuration.recommended answer: this is optional recommended answer text
